org.jgraphl

Interface AdjacencyGraph<V>

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    BidirectionalGraph<V>, DirectedGraph<V>, Graph<V>, IncidenceGraph<V>, MutableGraph<V>, UndirectedGraph<V>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractAdjacencyGraph, DirectedAdjacencyGraph, ImplicitGraph, MutableDirectedAdjacencyGraph, MutableUndirectedAdjacencyGraph, UndirectedAdjacencyGraph

    public interface AdjacencyGraph<V>
    The AdjacencyGraph provides interface for efficient access of the adjacent vertices to a vertex in a graph. This is quite similar to the IncidenceGraph interface (the target of an out-edge is an adjacent vertex). Both concepts are provided because in some contexts there is only concern for the vertices, whereas in other contexts the edges are also important.
    Design Rationale:
    The AdjacencyGraph interface is somewhat frivolous since IncidenceGraph really covers the same functionality (and more). The AdjacencyGraph concept exists because there are situations when adjacentVertices() is more convenient to use than outEdges().

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Stream<V> adjacentVertices(V v) 
      default void forEachAdjacentVertex(V u, Consumer<? super V> action) 

    • Method Detail

      • adjacentVertices

        Stream<V> adjacentVertices(V v)
        Parameters:
        v -
        Returns:
        an iterator providing access to the vertices adjacent to vertex v in this graph.
        Notes:
        The case of a multigraph (where multiple edges can connect the same two vertices) brings up an issue as to whether the iterators returned by the adjacentVertices() function access a range that includes each adjacent vertex once, or whether it should match the behavior of the outEdges() function, and access a range that may include an adjacent vertex more than once.

      • forEachAdjacentVertex

        default void forEachAdjacentVertex(V u,
                                   Consumer<? super V> action)
